intro: Seriphidium parishii, commonly known as the Parish's wormwood, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its gray-green foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Seriphidium parishii is often found in rocky areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
